author: suburbandad_
content: Nethermind is syncing from Besu , but I haven't tried the other direction yet

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Forkid rejected is very early in the protocol I think, so maybe an issue with dencun?

author: suburbandad_
content: it is peculiar because that node is peered with several other geth nodes.  Perhaps it is an early forkid...

author: .fjl
content: I also saw a forkid issue in hive recently, maybe there is a bug in besu related to it

author: suburbandad_
content:
what is the forkid for cancun mainnet?  

I confirmed this morning that sync'd besu nodes do not have any cancun-ready geth or reth peers

author: suburbandad_
content: disregard fork issue - our CI pipeline deployed a non-cancun ready geth.  We have very few canary nodes with geth peers for some reason though.

author: .fjl
content: looks like it was fixed recently

author: .fjl
content: on hive, eth tests failed due to wrong forkID with `besu/v24.1.2-dev-c45a8632/linux-x86_64/openjdk-java-17`

author: .fjl
content: the issue was resolved on the next run with  `besu/v24.1.2-dev-61c7e18a/linux-x86_64/openjdk-java-17`

author: suburbandad_
content: geth 1.13.14 syncing nicely from besu.  Our next release should have snap server, behind a feature flag.
